titlestmt.titleproper: Bethlehem Business Women's Club; Records apap389
titlestmt.author: Jodi Boyle

publicationstmt.publisher: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-03-23 23:00:09 -0400.

repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: This collection documents the operations of the Bethlehem Business Women's Club from its inception in 1951.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: This collection includes scrapbooks, administrative records, newsletters, and newspaper clippings.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Since 1951 the Bethlehem Business Women's (BBW) Club has been composed of women who live or work in the Town of Bethlehem, New York. The bBW offers an opportunity for its members meet, network, and support the town through various community activities. Originally chartered as The Bethlehem Business and Professional Women's Club and a charter member of the New York Federation of Business and Professional Women's Clubs, the BBW broke away from the Federation in 1960 believing its money would be better spent within the Bethlehem community.

Today the BBW is comprised of local women of all ages with diverse backgrounds and interests. The Club provides college scholarships to graduating high school seniors who reside in the Town of Bethlehem and who have shown both academic achievement and community service during their high school years. Other community services activites include contributions to the local food pantry, participation in the Adopt-a-Highway program, and supportint the local annual Holiday Community Dinner.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is organized alphabetically. There are no series. Inventory to follow shortly.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Marilyn Kaltenborn donated all materials to the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives in March 2021.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this record group is unrestricted.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Capital District Senior Issues Forum Records, 1998-2018. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Capital District Senior Issues Forum Records).
